{{pp-semi-vandalism|expiry=May 31, 2011|small=yes}}
{{pp-semi-vandalism|expiry=May 31, 2011|small=yes}}
  +
[[File:Burning the Israeli flag at embassy in Cairo.jpg|thumb|[[Egypt|Egyptian]] burning the Israeli's flag at embassy in Cairo.]]
'''Nakba Day''' in '''2011''' was the [[Nakba Day|annual day of commemoration]] for the [[Palestinian people]] marking the [[Nakba]] - the [[Creation of Israel#Demographic outcome|displacement]] that accompanied the [[Israeli Independence |creation]] of [[Israel]] in 1948. Generally held on May 15, commemorative events in 2011 began on May 10, in the form of march by Palestinian [[Arab citizens of Israel]] on Israel's [[Yom Ha'atzmaut|Independence Day]]. On May 13, clashes between stone-throwing youths and Israeli security forces in [[East Jerusalem]] resulted in one Palestinian fatality, and clashes continued there in the days following.
'''Nakba Day''' in '''2011''' was the [[Nakba Day|annual day of commemoration]] for the [[Palestinian people]] marking the [[Nakba]] - the [[Creation of Israel#Demographic outcome|displacement]] that accompanied the [[Israeli Independence |creation]] of [[Israel]] in 1948. Generally held on May 15, commemorative events in 2011 began on May 10, in the form of march by Palestinian [[Arab citizens of Israel]] on Israel's [[Yom Ha'atzmaut|Independence Day]]. On May 13, clashes between stone-throwing youths and Israeli security forces in [[East Jerusalem]] resulted in one Palestinian fatality, and clashes continued there in the days following.
